intro: Comarostaphylis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are elliptical and arranged in whorls around the stem. The fruit is a small, yellowish berry that ripens in the dry season and is edible when mature.
